questions.question: If he ……………………. like this, he will have an accident one of these days.
questions.description: Use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause to talk about real and possible situations.

questions.question: She said that she ……………………….. never forget me.
questions.description: Would is the past form of will. When the main clause is in the past tense, the subordinate clause too should be in the past tense.

questions.question: Though we played well, we …………………………. win the match.
She accused me of ………………………… her letters.
questions.description: A verb used after a preposition should be in its ing form.

questions.question: I couldn’t remember if I ……………………… the door.
She told me …………………….. lost.
questions.description: Imperative sentences are reported with a to-infinitive.

questions.question: My parents always encouraged me …………………………. big.
questions.description: Encourage is followed by object + to infinitive.

questions.question: I waited for hours but no one ………………………..
If you had been more careful, the accident ……………………………..
She insisted that I …………………………. her.
questions.description: This is an example of a subjunctive. Either go or should go is possible here.

questions.question: I would rather you …………………………. calling me.
questions.description: We use a past tense after would rather to refer to present or future.
